thread.title: Watch video: Inside visuals of Narendra Modi performing pooja at Kashi Vishwanath Temple
thread.title_full: Watch video: Inside visuals of Narendra Modi performing pooja at Kashi Vishwanath Temple

author: FE Online
title: Watch video: Inside visuals of Narendra Modi performing pooja at Kashi Vishwanath Temple
text:
Watch video: Inside visuals of Narendra Modi performing pooja at Kashi Vishwanath Temple Watch video: Inside visuals of Narendra Modi performing pooja at Kashi Vishwanath Temple PM Modi reached Kashi Vishwanath Temple and offered prayers at Kashi Vishwanath temple and he also visited the Kaal Bhairav temple. By: FE Online | Updated: March 4, 2017 3:22 PM Narendra Modi performing pooja at Kashi Vishwanath Temple. (ANI) 
Prime Minister Modi reached Varanasi on Saturday to lead the rallies and campaign for BJP for the 7th phase of the assembly elections in the state. When Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in the temple town of Varanasi for his road show amid huge enthusiasm from his supporters here in his parliamentary constituency. After a brief interaction, he moved in his bulletproof car in a cavalcade to a guest house. Thousands of people were lined up along the routes of Modi’s road show, ahead of the March 8 polls here. PM Modi reached Kashi Vishwanath Temple and offered prayers at Kashi Vishwanath temple and he also visited the Kaal Bhairav temple. PM tweeted, “Unforgettable moments in Kashi. It is always special being here. My gratitude to the people for the affection. Truly humbled.” Unforgettable moments in Kashi. It is always special being here. My gratitude to the people for the affection. Truly humbled. pic.twitter.com/Ehpn4Dl5AI 
— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) March 4, 2017 
PM Modi was caught in camera while performing pooja at Kashi Vishwanath Temple. Have a look: #Watch Prime Minister Narendra Modi performing ‘aarti’ at the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi pic.twitter.com/noIUBx99zz 
He was also seen offering prayers at Kaal Bherav PM Modi offering prayer at Kaal Bherav (ANI) PM Narendra Modi offered prayers at Kaal Bhairav temple in Varanasi. (ANI) 
Polling for the sixth phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 began today morning. Electorates at 17,926 polling booths across 49 Assembly seats have already started queueing up amid tight security arrangements. It’s a politically charged Saturday as Prime Minister Narendra Modi, SP Chief Akhilesh Yadav , Rahul Gandhi and BSP supremo Mayawati all descended on Varanasi today making it their battleground ahead of the last phase of UP polls and Apart from PM Modi’s campaign, the crucial Varanasi region will also see a slew of high-profile rallies by Uttar Pradesh chief minister Akhilesh Yadav, BSP supremo Mayawati and Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi. The pitching in of all top leaders has put the administration on its toes. According to the programme received by the district administration here, Modi is scheduled to address at his Lok Sabha constituency at about 3 PM. 
The seventh-phase of Assembly election is scheduled to take place on March 8 in which around 46 constituencies covering seven districts of Uttar Pradesh will cast their vote. Counting of votes will be done on March 11. Please Wait while comments are loading...
